page.title: 09KILDRUMMY CHURCH.
page.content: The present church was built about 1805,but there are very ancient stones in the graveyard surrounding it Closeby are the remains of a 13th cent Church. It is unusual in appearance and has been described as " you can make a kirk or a mill of it". The story that the architect mixed up the plans with those of a mill,still survive, but is probably untrue! The church belongs to the Church of Scotland. During the 19th cent. the church had a great influence in the district,the session clerk being the teacher in the school, which was founded by the church. With a dramatic fall in population and other factors attendance at church has fallen although attendance at Sunday school is excellent. Kildrummy and the village of Lumsden share one Minister.
